rule_requirement: Controllers must recognize universal opt-out mechanisms (UOOMs) such as Global Privacy Control (GPC) browser signals as valid opt-out requests for targeted advertising and sales of personal data

Controllers must provide clear and conspicuous privacy notice covering: categories of personal data collected; purposes of collection; categories of personal data shared or sold; categories of third parties; consumer rights including opt-out mechanisms

Consent must be: clear affirmative act; freely given; specific; informed; unambiguous. Prohibited consent practices: dark patterns; pre-checked boxes; acceptance of general terms only; hovering muting or pausing; consent bundled with acceptance of terms as precondition of service
Controllers must obtain new consent if processing purpose materially changes from originally disclosed purpose (implements ยง 6-1-1308(4) secondary use prohibition)
